(29) Ni -li -wa -amb-ia kufanya kazi zao. has to appear "more verbal" in the prefixed relative, when it has moved
1s-past-3pl-say-appl to do job their to C. This alternation does not occur anywhere else and native
"I told them to do their jobs." speakers are not consciously aware of its relation to the verb "want."

(30) Ni-na-ona kwamba Juma a -me-enda nyumbani. (38) Conclusion: some kind of [+V] requirement is driving movement of
1s-pres-see that Juma 3s-perf-go home. the highest verbal element to C in Swahili relatives. All elements
